channel.title: The DAX Shepherd
channel.description: Recent content on The DAX Shepherd

item.title: Defining Measures in DAX Studio
item.description: After a period of not defining measures in DAX Studio, I seem to make the same two mistakes. The first error occurs when I try to run the following code to define a measure in a query: DEFINE MEASURE [UnitPrice] = SUM('Sales'[Unit Price]) EVALUATE CALCULATE([UnitPrice]) This generates the following error: The syntax for ‘=’ is incorrect. . The issue lies in not including the table name before the measure name. This esentially indicates where the measure “lives” in the model and is needed for the full definition of the measure.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Intro to defining measures with syntax highlighting

item.title: Using Hugo and GitHub Pages for my blog
item.description: I would like to say that this blog has been relaunched on GitHub using Hugo. If something never launched in the first place I am not sure it can be relaunched. I initially had a WordPress blog on SiteGround. It never made it out of test. I learned a lot about deploying WordPress and the different plugins. It did come in handy when my work started using WordPress for the company site.

item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Jason Romans and I work on the Microsoft business intelligence stack. I live in Nashville, Tennessee with my wife. I grew up in Southern California in the town of Perris. My first computer was a Commodore 64. Since then I have been hooked on computers. I would go to the computer show at the fairgrounds to buy all the parts to build or upgrade my pc. Building my newest PC was a different experience since all I had to do was click to purchase the parts and wait for them to arrive.

item.title: My Work
item.description: I work in a small IT shop. What this means is that I have to be self motivated to learn new skills and to apply them to projects I am working on. I had to have faith that if I built out data models using Microsoft BI that the business would see the value and benefit. A build and and they will come scenario. Lastly it means that I have to wear many hats from gathering requirements from the business to developing the best data model, to creating measures, and lastly to how the data will be presented on the canvas (whether Excel or Power BI).

item.title: Resources
item.description: This list is not an exhaustive list but I want to keep track of books, podcasts, and websites that I have found helpful. Podcasts Raw Data by P3 Adaptive As soon as I hear the familiar “Hello Friends” it makes we feel like I am among friends. Discussing topics about data and analytics emphasizing how it impacts the business SQL Data Partners Data Driven RunAsRadio Power Query Magic Kasper On BI BIFocal - Clarifying Business Intelligence Books Definitive Guide to DAX - Second Edition PowerPivot Book Master Your Data with Excel and Power BI Websites SQLBI P3 Adaptive Radacad Brent Ozar Tools Model Auto Build DAX.
